title_sort: hannah whitman heyde to walt whitman, march 15 [1892]
title: Hannah Whitman Heyde to Walt Whitman, March 15 [1892]
text: Tuesday Morning Burlington VtMarch 15 [1892]Only write a line my dear darling brother thinking maybe to day[today] you feel a little better can only hope & hope you may. I think of you morning noon and night, would like to write every day to you but are going to wait till you get better. well[Well] enough dear dear brother to sit up, in your chair again & that will be such good news to hear your letters & the money you send all comes safely.— but your writing to me now—there is[are] no words to say & I wont[won't] try. you[You] are the only one in the whole world, would be, so good to me. —What does me good or what is a comfort to me is nothing, you, are the one I care for my darling.very[Very] many ask after you. Dr[Dr.] Bingham says no one has as many friends, & said he wished he was where he could do something for you although he knew you had everything.It seems as if I could not help writing to day kept thinking of you last night & this morning but I must not tire you if I could only do a bit of good—want[Want] to send much much love, & I do feel for you my dear dear brother.—Lou has been kind about writing —C. yesterday sold (without frame) picture for $15. may sell more if takes price offered — sold one before some weeks ago., same priceI thank you brother dear for sending me so much money—you are wonderful good to me.I pray you may be gaining a little by now,—love alwaysHan Hannah Whitman Heyde to Walt Whitman, March 15 [1892]
